content.1: He that is wounded in the stones, or hath his privy member cut off, shall not enter into the congregation of the
content.2: A bastard shall not enter into the congregation of the
content.3: An Ammonite or Moabite shall not enter into the congregation of the
content.4: Because they met you not with bread and with water in the way, when ye came forth out of Egypt; and because they hired against thee Balaam the son of Beor of Pethor of Mesopotamia, to curse thee.
content.6: Thou shalt not seek their peace nor their prosperity all thy days for ever.
content.7: Thou shalt not abhor an Edomite; for he
content.8: The children that are begotten of them shall enter into the congregation of the
content.9: When the host goeth forth against thine enemies, then keep thee from every wicked thing.
content.10: If there be among you any man, that is not clean by reason of uncleanness that chanceth him by night, then shall he go abroad out of the camp, he shall not come within the camp:
content.11: But it shall be, when evening cometh on, he shall wash
content.12: Thou shalt have a place also without the camp, whither thou shalt go forth abroad:
content.13: And thou shalt have a paddle upon thy weapon; and it shall be, when thou wilt ease thyself abroad, thou shalt dig therewith, and shalt turn back and cover that which cometh from thee:
content.15: Thou shalt not deliver unto his master the servant which is escaped from his master unto thee:
content.17: There shall be no whore of the daughters of Israel, nor a sodomite of the sons of Israel.
content.18: Thou shalt not bring the hire of a whore, or the price of a dog, into the house of the
content.19: Thou shalt not lend upon usury to thy brother; usury of money, usury of victuals, usury of any thing that is lent upon usury:
content.20: Unto a stranger thou mayest lend upon usury; but unto thy brother thou shalt not lend upon usury: that the
content.21: When thou shalt vow a vow unto the
content.22: But if thou shalt forbear to vow, it shall be no sin in thee.
content.23: That which is gone out of thy lips thou shalt keep and perform;
content.24: When thou comest into thy neighbour’s vineyard, then thou mayest eat grapes thy fill at thine own pleasure; but thou shalt not put
content.25: When thou comest into the standing corn of thy neighbour, then thou mayest pluck the ears with thine hand; but thou shalt not move a sickle unto thy neighbour’s standing corn.
